cyclone.name: OMAR
cyclone.current_location: about 190 mi SSW of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving northeast to east-northeast and expected to continue accelerating away from the U.S. East Coast over the open Atlantic

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Rip-current and surf impacts mainly along the Outer Banks of North Carolina; little direct impact expected along the South Carolina coast
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected at Port of Charleston; breezy conditions at or below 25 mph possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected because the cyclone remains well offshore.
weather_observation.rainfall: Only isolated light showers possible; significant rainfall unlikely.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low-level swell and occasionally rough surf possible, but main rip-current risk is farther north along the Outer Banks.
